title: WCAS PSYCH 314-0-25 Special Topics in Psychology

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Lots of people have beliefs that other people think are just plain weird. Why do people have these beliefs? We'll examine some "weird" beliefs and try to understand what leads people to develop and maintain these beliefs. A complication arises since one person's "weird" belief may be another person's firmly held conviction. From this perspective, we'll also try to understand which beliefs are rational. Among the topics we will cover are: superstition, ESP and parapsychology, ghosts, witchcraft and magic, alien abduction, repressed memories of abuse, and creationism/intelligent design. Students will learn to use a wide variety of academic and popular press resources (including empirical research articles, ethnographic descriptions, philosophical arguments, popular press books, and documentary films) to explore the bases for these beliefs and practices.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Evaluation Method: Grades will be based on weekly written reaction papers, class participation, and a final paper.
